Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-Du (Phylloseptin-du; PS-du; Phylloseptin-3.1TR; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; Variant: Phylloseptin-3.3TR)
Sequence Information.Source: Trinidadian leaf frog,Phyllomedusa trinitatis, also skin secretions,Phyllomedusa duellmani, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 100 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 12.5 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 25 uM). This amidated form is more active than the non-amidated form. Found in multiple species, including that byConlon2018.Variant: Phylloseptin-3.3TR (Mechkarska et al., 2018) share the same sequence but C-terminally amidated. Active against C. albicans (MIC 100 uM). Updated 2/2018; 7/2021; merged with AP2994 (amidated) 2/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Yang N, Li L, Wu D, Gao Y, Xi X, Zhou M, Wang L, Chen T, Shaw C.2016
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of Novel Bacterial Cell-Penetrating Phylloseptins in Defensive Skin Secretions of the South American Hylid Frogs, Phyllomedusa duellmani and Phyllomedusa
